comments.author: Xi
comments.content: I quite like living in London, wouldn't change it for the world!! I think I'd rather stick pins in my eyes if I had to move back to Kuala Lumpur. Too sweaty, sticky and smelly. However, I do miss ice katchung and cendol. Mmm... E numbers and snotty, leechy looking things.

comments.author: Xi
comments.content: I don't hate Malaysia, I'd jut rather avoid when possible!

comments.author: Kamil
comments.content: I thought you said you'll stop blogging...I will find Hong Kong too pressurising to live in. I'm sure if I wasn't from there, Hong Kong would be a brilliant place. I like Japan as it reminds me of Hong Kong before all the pollution. I would never go back to Japan for good, its too soul-less for me. I will continue to move to new places in search for my home. London is very close to it, but I know it won't be for long.

comments.author: Slowvelder
comments.content: When I left Africa to live in Europe I was glad to be getting away.  After three years living and working in Europe I chose to return to one of the most beautiful countries in the world - my home - South Africa.  I really enjoyed my experience as an expat, loved Europe, but my greatest lesson was learning to love my home country and appreciating all we have here.

comments.author: Kamil
comments.content: @Slowvelder: Yes, I agree with you that South Africa is a great country! Hopefully I will get to visit again soon...

comments.author: Xi
comments.content: I loved South Africa when I went last year! But I don't think I could live there. The only place I can picture myself relocating to is Stockholm, but I don't know why.
